lines.text: We really haven't had a barn-burner since we got back from the big do, you know. We should get your sister, we should get Shaun, we should get Allura and Kima and anyone who's in town.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's have a good drink, and in the morning we'll set off on the next leg of idiocy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A dear friend is gone, so, apologies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did I at least cause you some harm in the battle?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought you would go down in one shot, and you were still standing!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I still feel a little ill.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! And look, you singed a little of my hair!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, we've killed dragons, so the fact that you actually managed to hold it together is actually quite impressive!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, clearly we've been fucking with you a little bit, but you have ability and skill, and that's not bullshit. Seriously.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, the rest's just fake it 'til you make it, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't see any of it, so I'm not sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was really great. It was really great?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, thank you all. I'm sorry for deceiving you before, and I promise to do better and to aid you in whatever way I can. Please teach me your ways, and I will learn what I can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For heaven's sake, yes! I did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe him, I believe him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's open him up and figure out if he's lying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's all right. Let's go get drunk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get drunk and make people cry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's been too long, are you kidding?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I hang back just a little bit to collect myself. Just try to dry my eyes, and I say to Doty: Doty, just delete most of that last chapter--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sounds of Doty ripping and crumpling paper)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: -- and take this down. "The battle a draw, Taryon decided it was better to lie than tell the "truth, and embarked on a new adventure pretending to be their humble intern, when in actuality, "they were working for him." End of chapter!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sounds of book slamming shut and Doty walking)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh my gosh, that can go in any direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're getting to the deep end!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hi. Apparently there's still a lot of recovery that's needed in Emon and they need kind of an "all-hands-on-deck circumstance with anyone who's trained in healing, "so I may have to go help with that for a little bit, if that's okay?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, don't-- don't go-- (sigh) don't go to any crazy hell places without me, let me know before that happens, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's exactly what they're planning on doing!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, Tary, what did we say about lying?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They just said that they're taking me to hell, or something like that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we won't, obviously, if you don't want us to, Pike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've decided to go a little softer with him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, try and at least let me know?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike, I have to eventually go visit the Water Ashari, but I didn't want to do that without you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine, go! I mean, I don't know how much help I'll be other than just getting you there, but there's plenty of people that can, you know, helm a ship and get you across the sea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there any advice you can give?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hire a good crew. Really. I was but one of many and everything I learned, I learned from watching other people. You might learn more than I did!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How are you? I mean, you're heading off to Emon right after Scanlan left, does this have anything to do with him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll be fine, I mean, it's all tying up loose ends, and I'm more needed helping people that really need what I can do right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know Keeper Yennen's coming along--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- and we're gonna be doing some people some real good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her light can definitely heal a lot of wounds and spirits, so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't always have to put on a brave face, dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She lets go of Allura's hand, runs up real fast, and just slugs you in the face--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You go be a monster, and you heal all the people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Bye." She turns around and runs back to Allura.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After Yennen is summoned forth, the three of them vanish into a swirl of arcane energy, towards the direction of Emon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (exhales) First one goes, then the other.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Sorry. I don't-- I'm just trying to catch up. I'll--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was a good exercise in restraint, Grog. Proud of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come here. Tell me more about your father.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's really a rotten guy. (sighs) He does these unfair deals-- nobody knows about them but me, and I tried to tell him to play on the up and up but he's just a liar and a cheat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's terrible. Drink up, by the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So how long have you been set forth on your little mission to prove yourself worthy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hired a band of mercenaries to assist me for the first month.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you really get them killed?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thought you would've made a shitty name like that one up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow, your dad really is an asshole.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How's your sister, at least? Is your sister reasonable?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, she's so-- She's such a jock. She just does push-ups and sit-ups and pull-ups all day and all night and beats on me. She's younger than me, but she's so much stronger.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Her name is-- I wrote this down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's my sister's name? You don't know!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is Mary-Anne older or younger than you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's all focused on the business, and taking it over when Dad's ready to retire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Was there anything good about your upbringing? Any positive points?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Yes, I learned so much. I was left to my own devices for hours on end. I traveled the world... in literature. And I experienced such great adventures, tales of history and fiction and-- For most of my life, I was just a happy-go-lucky kid in my room. Reading my books, and making up characters that I would fight against, and only recently have things gotten pretty bad with Dad, since I am now of age to take over the business, and uh--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, he's getting up in years. Wants to retire to the southern villa.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is such a dark mirror. This is a very dark mirror.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tary. That was a Freudian slip. Why does your father think it's important to have brute strength and combat experience to run a business?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's less about strength and more about a cutthroat attitude. Take no prisoners. Hold back nothing. Pull no punches.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you sure your father's a real estate agent?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But (inhales) I do know that he is ruthless and a bastard, if you ask me truthfully.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. What do you mean? (all laugh)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean. What do I mean? I mean, was he the offspring of--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure he does. Was he married to your mother?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think so. They were around a lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a long walk to get to shithead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was a long walk to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a lot of backstory here that you're not privy to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Show him your tattoo, I'm just sort of curious. I just had a thought.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My tattoo? What? The Slayer's Take?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a fucking Keyleth palm at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I burnt it off of him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're gonna make me draw it? That's fine. I'm doing the Clasp logo, if I-- Does this look at all familiar? I have the Clasp logo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. You're all literate? You can read and write?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. I haven't met many of you in my travels that have--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You guys have a lot in common.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have quite a nice library.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, there's a lot of differences between the two of you, but you have a lot in common.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I was a bit of a reader growing up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. Fiction and non-fiction. A bit of everything. I was a--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Perhaps we can compare books later?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will happily show you my library.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can teach him the art of nerd chic, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He seems to be well-built for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, Percy is a bit of a tinkerer himself as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. Yes, I've built a few things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That piece of equipment you showed to that weirdo earlier today-- the thing with the handle?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I didn't make that, but I did make this one. And I pull down the folded ridiculous--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I keep filling up Grog's mug, to make sure he gets his fill.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does that-- What does that do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow. And did you make this by yourself?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did. This took about six months? Seven months? I mean, I'd been thinking about it for quite a while. I'm working on a few others, too--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is kind of the definitive-- Yes, this is when we were all--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Built it on our little summer vacation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- on the last time we took a break.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the propellant part of this piece right here? Or is it in that big piece right there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you make of all this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you think of the new guy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah. He's weird? I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I forgot, I owe you some money, don't I?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I didn't die. So, minus the Prismatic Spray, that's 6000 gold taken off. Minus the wear and tear on my armor and equipment, that's another 5000 taken off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Darling, this wasn't part of the deal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Minus the fact that I wasn't the star of the adventure, I'll halve the rest of it. Do you have a tax ID or some sort of tax-exempt status?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, you need to be the lead character in your death-taunting? Is that what you're telling us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just trying to find out how much I actually owe you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No contract stipulations when we made the deal, therefore, you pay full price, darling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am a man of business and I always follow the law. So by my calculations, 20% federal taxes, 9.5% local and city taxes, I put that at about 11,000 gold total left still. Doty?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My father will pay that. In full.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can put it in the treasury, technically.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did he just give us an IOU?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about all the jingly-jangly in your bag of holding?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go on and reach in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know how bags of holding work.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll just stick my hand in the bag of holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is empty. What are you thinking of while you reach in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. It's just a void, an empty sack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is bullshit! You can't come with us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he holding any equipment or weapons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The weapon is near him, but not currently on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Fire. And I set his weapon on fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as your hammer just ignites with flame.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no, it's magical, it's good. It helps!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why would you touch a flame?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because you said it was magical!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well... I don't feel like I can answer that question appropriately at the moment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know when people poke you in the sternum with their finger? I do that with the Titanstone Knuckle really hard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm just getting used to this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, you're fitting in very well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have your strengths, and while you may be able to "read" with your friends over there, I think it's also important to work on your weaknesses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, so we gotta work on your bravery, maybe your fighting voice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it really bad? Did I sound okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I mean, I wasn't there to witness it, I just know your normal voice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When you were flying over the city, did it sound like a llama being mauled by a pack of wolves?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I heard this braying. I thought it was a goat, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Big tall neck, all furry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm still a fucking mess. That's the thing, people are writing stories about us, we're a bunch of fucking shitheads, and nobody talks about that-- maybe a few people do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A few people do talk about that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A few people do talk about that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think more than a few.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A lot of people talk about that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no way to prepare, you just have to hit your face against the wall a couple of times, then it starts to feel normal-ish.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can help you with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're good, you've done it, you've been hazed, you're good, kid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will make you guest-stars in one chapter of my book, and it will be top three most epic chapters.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is the money that you're paying us with your father's money as well? Please be honest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll get you a room right next to the library so you can have easy access.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can set that up right away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The doors don't lock, though, so you have to be on guard all night long. Training is a 24-hour regimen around here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I accept your conditions.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll give you access to the workshop if you feel like building yourself a lock. Feel free.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In the morning, we'll do a brief tour.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Absolutely. And I could show you the inner workings of Doty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's pretty outstanding if I do say so myself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very good work, I'm very impressed.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Little bit of luck, little bit of magic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want us to excuse the two of you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of them, as you guys are having this conversation, without realizing it, slowly exit together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, then you stop yourself as you reach the door.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna send him to the library at the very least.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the waitstaff come in and retrieve your belongings and lead you up to the chamber that'll be prepared for your evening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What a babe in the woods.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, how ragey are you right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All the people who tend not to like people are liking him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a terrible sign, isn't it? Just really, really disturbing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like the two of you never like the same person.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, we don't have the weight of the world crushing us at the moment, so I feel like that might have something to do with it, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It feels very strange for you two to be agreeing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought we were taking a break from risk-taking for a second.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I feel like we've been playing it very safe, it's just been that the world has been taking risks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love the way you frame things, Percy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Once again you're a couple steps ahead of us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love the way you lawyer your way out of every situation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could check in on him. Haven't used the scrying eye today.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wanna say let's give him some privacy, but at the same time I do kind of want to see him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just want to know if he's all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna look. I take out the scrying eye.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk over to Grog and start playing-- what was it? Rock, paper, what was it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Trying to teach Grog that game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't want you to look in on him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'm done for the evening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why? We just want to make sure he's okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we respect that or not? Or did you want him to yell at you more when we see him again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He can't know if I'm scrying on him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He might know if you're scrying on him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not if I use my scrying eye.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's give him a little bit of time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, Grog. That's a very fair point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because, you know, it occurs to me, I've never given you a full tour of the treasury room, have I?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm grabbing the wine and I'm leaving right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You guys are gonna fuck in the treasury? Oh my god! (all laugh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As we leave, I turn to Grog. And I think about talking to him for just a second, and then I leave the room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I owe you for that shit. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As the rest of you wind down the evening, drinking, perusing the treasury, reading the various books that are at your disposal--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do deposit the check at the treasury, by the way, while we're there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find your evening to a close.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We haven't had the night off in a while.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You enjoy the time to relax a bit and take another breath of air after this constant pressure that's been pushing you. Next morning comes in as the sun rises, you all come to consciousness, rouse yourselves for breakfast, and whatever the next day ensues. You all begin to gather in the common room of the castle once more.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Airship or sea ship? This is your call.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've never done a sea ship.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I think we've got some-- We could go after the dude in hell, but I think we have some more time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should bring a Pike to hell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have twenty six hundred men in the back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Do I know roughly where the water ashari are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you don't really know. Maybe a little bit of information-gathering, or asking people who may traverse that area would help you, but you don't really know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not in Whitestone. I think we're pretty landlocked.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. There is actually, technically there's the sea to the north, but that would be useless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you have the Lucidian Ocean to the east of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it is a very treacherous water, and the Shearing Channel, that is the series of broken land mass between here and Wildmount, the one that the Briarwoods were brokering the bridge for, is-- yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a reason we're not a poor city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there like a port at the very south end of the continent, to where we could hop a ship and also do some research?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Uh, there's Stillben, very very far south.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Emon is the closest port city to head to the Ozmit Sea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay well then, hang on. If it's w-- Nope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I was about to say, who has the map? You have the map. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Cause the Earth Ashari are on the eastern side of the continent. Right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is a conversation that is happening right now. I'm so amused.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're trying to remember the fake geography--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Writing all this down for a book for all you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, Emon is the place to go to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. We're up here. Whitestone's here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we need to be the south-west, so--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We will live in the stars.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Emon's here. Emon is the biggest port city on the Ozmit Sea, isn't it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we might as well leave out of Emon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We might as well leave out of Emon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then I could also do some research, because-- Is the libraries and the lyceums and stuff open again? Or are they just fucking demolished?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. I mean, a lot of that part of the town is just now being rebuilt and recovered so--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where's the airship by the way, as well?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When was the last time we saw them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The last time you saw them was in the throes of the battle with Thordak, when they came in and gave it a helping hand briefly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just to keep up the audience: We're in Maine, and we're trying to get to Los Angeles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As Taryon, can't we teleport to wherever we're trying to go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's easier to teleport if you're already been there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And the Ashari are a very reclusive type people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've read about most people and places.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you read about the Water Ashari and the Ashari people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm gonna join in on this history check as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) No one knows what it's like, to be a bad man. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you wanna touch my antlers?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not terrible, I just had a very high history.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not terrible, but your research hasn't delved too deeply into the Ashari. And the Ashari that you do know of are the Terra and uh, and the Air Ashari.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I've only got what I read at home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the Terra and the Zephra. Those are the only two you know about. Those are the only two on the continent. The Vesrah you're not too familiar with.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, who else can we talk to?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I guess I could always go back to the Earth Ashari, or the Air Ashari, and talk to some of those people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe somebody at the docks in Emon would know?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She really wants to go to the docks in Emon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys haven't been there yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go to the Earth Ashari.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's collect our things. What's the temperature like there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right now, with it being the Season of-

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is far from civilization, it's maybe a few days of heavy mountain-- constant hiking north of where Kraghammer is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. We'd have to hike to get there? No, there's gotta be trees that I can Tree Stride there to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a couple that aren't too far outside of Terra that you can Tree Stride to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're druids, there's gotta be trees within that camp, right? And stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, I'm saying that there are some that are like, just in the outskirts of Terra, none directly in it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Would not have helped me very much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's also say, as we're getting ready, I'm gonna take Tary down and let him pick through the tinkering room, see if he needs any tools and upgrade anything that he might need, give him a quick tour.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I wanna talk to Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys are taking through the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find Grog off to the side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm good. I slept really well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is difficult for me to do. Did you know that Scanlan had acquired drugs?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just found this out, that he was using drugs behind our back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think so, I mean, I've never tried them, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So, I don't know, finding out secrets about people doesn't feel good. Feeling like they've broken your trust in some way, right? And being trustworthy is very important.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right, yeah, I think that's very important.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not even fighting anyone right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah. I pull out the deck. So, this is-- Do you know what this is? Do you remember this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When you asked me for this before, I lied. To you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't-- I was afraid-- I gave you a false deck.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, you gave it to me, it's in my bag.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But you said I wasn't supposed to look at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you're still not supposed to, technically. Do you want me to pull it out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I-- Should you-- Do you just--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You want me to get the deck out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, I am taking it from your hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't take them from me again!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog! Open your eyes. It's not really a deck, you see? It's a bag. With rocks in it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you take my salt lick rock?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. You gave that to Scanlan. Here's your deck. Still don't use it, still don't look at it, it's still very dangerous! But I want you to know that I trust you with it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know. You said, "Don't look at it," and I haven't looked at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good, then still don't, how about that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want a card? What're you worried about, it's a deck of cards.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Please don't make me regret this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry that I lied to you. Even though you didn't notice. I want you to know you can still trust me, and I can still trust you to not fuck with this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would like to insight check Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you got your deck back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You-- It's really confusing. She's talking at you, but nothing changed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we just skip to the part where you get so frustrated that I haven't got it and you just tell me the answer anyway?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm glad you have our back. Don't do drugs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you think Scanlan did with the rest of those drugs?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you mean 'the rest of the drugs'?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, you said he was doing drugs, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, did he just take them with him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, I put the deck away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys head up to Scanlan's room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both you guys make investigation checks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was the most brilliant thing you have ever done.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am so consistently proud of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Together you both see-- You both spend the better part of an hour thumbing through the various drawers and odd boxes and sundries that were left behind in the wake of Scanlan's departure. And at the same time you both come to find that, no, there are-- no illegal substances remain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Other things, what else is in the room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Honestly? There are no nudey pictures, per se.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do find a series of books on art and the human physique.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And all the corresponding images have been torn out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have magic that can make things that are way more real than a drawing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He has three original print issues of Cherry Comics number one through four.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I guess he took them with him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. When do I get to look at the cards?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I don't know what they do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Only one way to find out! Not today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You've joined the rest of the party, the rest of-- After you guys finish your perusal of the workshop, which is quite a workshop, mundane in a lot of ways, but functional for the basic purposes of tinkering.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think it's magnificent, what you've put together here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I'm impressed, and from me that's quite a compliment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm feeling it. And, my workshop, obviously, is your workshop for as long as you stay here. Anything you need to work on, of course, it's fully available.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know what? I don't normally do this, but... What's your name? (all laugh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god. He doesn't know any of our names!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is so amazing. Percival Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Rolo the third. At your service.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percival Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Rolo the third. All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You are in Whitestone, as our guest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is my honor and privilege to be your guest, sir.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A pleasure. I recommend eventually, not necessarily today 'cause I am actually enjoying it, learning everyone else's name as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No it's-- I'm okay with it, I'm rolling with it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doty! Doty, put it as a maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doty, put it as a maybe for catchphrases.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Together, prepare yourselves for what the next step of your journey is. What are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we going? Are we going?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Got your stuff together? Everything you need?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we going to Emon? No. We're going to the earth-- the earth people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we can be like, where do I find the other fourth of my tribe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I've got my safety tags.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've got your rights written on the back, so that, y'know. If anyone tries to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We decorated them at the last winter festival.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Eyes on the prize.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You guys find your way to the Sun Tree. Utilizing Transport via Plants you find yourself (teleportation sound) thrust through the trunk of the Sun Tree, and emerging on the opposite side, on the cusp of a deep bowl-like valley that goes probably for a good mile and a half, or two miles across, before you reach the other side of this crest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tary! That's two times! You've teleported two times.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We are in the central Cliffkeep

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of Tal'Dorei. And of the central-- Of the Cliffkeep Mountains.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are traversing down into it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a short time, you find one of the paths that kinda zigzags down the side of this mountain drop, and make your way in towards the center. The sun is now-- I'd say at this time, just over the very top, kind of noon-ish portion of the day. You begin to walk your way in and it's very warm here, partially because the-- It's northern enough where usually it's a colder temperature on the island-- Don't you even, you motherfucker.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow. You lasered in on that like nobody's business!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But the further down you get it is just-- The tree line has stopped and it is just rock, stone, that is reflecting the light and it is warm. You're starting to find yourself sweat in your full armor as you traverse deeper and deeper into the center of this mountain valley.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's always like 20 degrees warmer in the valley.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for turning us into an episode of California, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a little bit of Los Angeles actor humor for you guys over in Sweden today.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To get to Critical Role, take the 101 with the 5 to get up to Burbank to get to Critical Role.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For all you fans in Germany, that's a little San Fernando valley humor!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I loved it, you can do no wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So as you continue downward, you get maybe a quarter-mile into this walk, still relatively far from the village, before-- And you recognize this. You watch as one of the nearby trenches, (earth moving) shifts up about two feet in stone, and you watch as three figures step out from within the trench and begin walking towards you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stop-- No, no? These are-- Grog!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're sending us to the things we're going to kill.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone, wait for a second. I step forward a second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You watch as three humanoids approach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just a stick. Just a stick. It doesn't do anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her jaw protrudes a bit, you can see the two lower fangs kinda pushing past the lips.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, she's got the big teeth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not that I would know that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I know Dryden from before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is not the headmaster of the tribe,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But one of the central sentinels that's around this portion here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you fared well here recently, in the past several months?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have hunkered down. Our business was to make sure that no more of the Rifts befall the same fate of the Pyrah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you talked to Cerkonos or Korren at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then this is a time for celebration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was wondering if I could speak to Headmaster Patisse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perhaps, but what do you wish to speak on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I need information from him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the Vesrah. Very well. I could help you with this information if need be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean it would just be nice to, like, say hi. While I'm here at least.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (loud rock slide) And you hear this heavy rolling rumble, and you watch as, maybe 300 feet off from the side, a new pinnacle is formed. Two big plates kind of (crack), jut upward, one kind of coasting over the other and coming to a halt. There is very heavy localized seismic activity as part of the proximity to the rift of the earth elemental plane here. And you watch as three druids come rushing out of the side of the Terra tribe, and as they focus, the rocks (crumbling noises) crumble back down and subside. The central mountain landscape, here, brought back to a momentary beat of peace and quiet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm like a New Yorker on a subway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just like, whatever. Used to this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Must wreak havoc on the local architexture.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fine, they're used to it here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. As you progress inward, and some of the other Terra Ashari--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut your mouth, you wouldn't even know what architecture is!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Different visual representations. Some appear to be more ornamental. Jewelry seems to be here, like jewels and metallics used, it seems to connote a level of prestige within the tribe, and every individual that walks, usually with a cluster or protectors around them, or at least, seems to be in a place of notable importance within groups, seems to be more adorned in this natural-based jewelry. You know exactly where to go to head straight to the hut in which the headmaster resides and as--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I'm watching her stride through here with confidence, just impressed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rockcaller. Rockcaller. Oh Jerry! How you been? How's the kids?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What looks to be a heavy wooden doorway, built out of a series of tree trunks that are strapped to this one area. Just (tree trunks shifting) shifts open and now you see, walks a very tall, thin, and older, like mid-60s human male, who is adorned in a similar tattoo pattern as the Rockcaller you saw earlier. But it seems to reside from the center of the cheeks and through the jowls and then crosses across the neck and then across the arms all the way down to the fingertips.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What can we be of service to you for?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good to see you, Patisse, it's been quite some time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just came to check in after the recent events in the world, make sure everyone was okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything seems to be fine. We've been intent of care to the rift, and from the word that seems to have passed quickly since your arrival over the past few days, it's come to our attention that Thordak no longer sits in the center of the city of Emon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's correct. We've also slain his right-hand man, Raishan, who seemed to be the mastermind of the entire orchestration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you. I couldn't have done it without your help and training, so I appreciate that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are but a seed, you allowed it to germinate. So what do you need?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I'm intent on continuing on with my Aramente now that there's relative peace in the world. The Vesrah people are quite insular, of course. I was wondering if you could give me some advice on how to get there and any advice in general on dealing with them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has been a long time since I've attended any sort of gathering with the Vesrah. It is for people of our skill set not the easiest of journeys, as many of us are capable of traversing through the sentinels of nature. Unfortunately, most of the tree life that exists around Vesrah is beneath the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So your most likely form of transport will be that of a vessel across the waves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who's their headmaster there now? Do you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The headmaster there-- Uvenda, the heart of the tides.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What can I expect of this Uvenda? Uvenda.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not what you'd expect. I'll leave it at that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's very vague of you, Patisse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, what would be the fun if I were to unveil the next fold of your Aramente?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, you've got a point. Do you recommend by ship or would flight be more appropriate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have the means, that is up to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Any other words of encouragement?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, sorry, I probably should've introduced-- by the way, this is my band I've been traveling with, Vox Machina. And Tary. Tary Darrington.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lovely to meet you. I have no idea where we are right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I ask a question? Is that all right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (quietly) Hi, sorry. You mentioned that the water Ashari live under the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They don't live beneath the water, not entirely.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I thought maybe they were like mer-people or something, I wasn't sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, right? That'd be really cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool. So we'll see them above land then if we're flying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some of them. All right, that was my question. Thank you for your answer. Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any other landmarks or ways of navigation to find them? They're an island in the middle of the Ozmit sea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The beaches and sands of Vesrah are built upon a great circular reef. And part of the city lies above, part of it lies below.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look for the white sands beneath the surface. Some structures will be visible from above. It would lie quite a ways to the southwest, not too far from the Hespit. I would recommend perhaps procuring the service of someone who knows the sea well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. We were going to look into trying to do that. Well, is there anything you need from me, Patisse, before we head on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. Just do your best to have your friends keep the location of our village to themselves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't worry, we have many places we'd prefer to keep this way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The tempest needs a new voice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I pull Vax aside and say--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Poise, grace, confidence, she is amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm learning so much already, thank you again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's good. One step at a time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vax, you made sure Tary partook of some of the soil here, right? It's an Ashari tradition, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What? Are you asking me if he shit here? What are you talking about?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no. He has to eat-- did you? Tary, did you manage to get some of the soil in your mouth?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a custom here you have to eat the dirt of the earth Ashari.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk off. I'm not getting part of this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't want to be offensive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (coughs) You go into an immediate coughing fit as the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- the surface dirt here is built from constant colliding of stone and rock, and a lot of it has been ground to almost a fine powder in places--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't dilute it with any water or anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just thinking, it's like diatomaceous earth. Just hateful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that is my vocal cords being covered in dirt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why are your vocal cords covered in dirt?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why on earth would you eat dirt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go into my satchel and pull out some healing draught, and just-- ah, just take a big gulp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kiki, what do you think? Are we staying here for the night, or-- I mean, we just got here, it's the middle of the day, isn't it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We need to make camp? You need to rest? Or can we go now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm good. After this we'll probably have-- No, I'm good. I mean--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We Treestride, we get a ship, and then--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- we spend a night on the ship.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't been on a ship si-- Oh my, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we gonna do the airship, or-- no, I guess we left the airship in Whitestone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or did we leave it in Emon?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hopefully, it's-- you know, let's see if it's still intact.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's wrong with a boat? We haven't been on a boat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm kind of feeling the boat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys wanna go on a boat?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are feeling the boat over the airship?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't been on a boat in a long time, and I'm feeling a little weird about an airship.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know, but you practically sang ballads for airships for weeks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I wouldn't object to it, I just--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So one and done, all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can be regular pirates now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does this mean we can get yacht gear if we go on a boat-- or pirate gear?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not getting the proper shoes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Boat shoes? I own boat shoes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're great, they're flat-soled, they are white, and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You mean like Keds? You're talking about Keds?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're actually boating shoes. I am embarrassed that I know exactly what you're talking about.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your boating shoes, I'm sure, are very white.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are they made of, leather?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is-- that is my favorite phrase in the English language, is "I have a kit for that."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a kit for that. (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have just come upon it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm so excited that worked out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find your way back to the edge of the valley, to the same tree that you made your Transport via Plants through--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do the touristy thing to 'em again on the way out, like I do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pointing out. What is your destination tree?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our keep. Greyskull Keep. Garden. Tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. That just took a while to find in my brain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I imagine you saying all that as you touch the tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (stammers) It's been a long few weeks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Only the best, only the best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You transport from the outskirts of Terra, find your way back to Greyskull Keep, and walking towards Emon proper. You can see now, even from the distance as you approach, the walls, some of the larger buildings, the higher towers and structures that just barely peek over the wall, you can see are already in the process of repair. You can see--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The damage was extensive, but not universal in the city, and so I'd say there's still a good 60% to 70% of the city that is mostly without damage, and there are areas that are just destroyed, but even those, people are picking up, reclaiming-- There appears to be a process of memorial being constructed on the outskirts of the Cloudtop to remember those who fell in the battle for Emon. There is also the skyport, which was on the outskirts of the Cloudtop, and up there you can see the skyship Deera, however it looks to have sustained a severe amount of damage--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- in the battle, and is in the process of also receiving its own repairs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I hope Captain Damon's all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's just gotten a little scar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's got the-- no, he's got the Harrison Ford.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this the Harrison Ford, or is it the scar right below the cheek so that when he cries it hits the scar and goes down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, and it trickles down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean either way, he can make it work, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. All right, so what are you guys doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like a little pachinko machine of pain.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Run the canal, run the canal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't leave me hanging up top. Woo!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike's here, right? She's in the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike is in the city somewhere, you haven't found her, you don't know where she is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 'Cause I imagine she would have good recommendations on good crews--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, let's try and find Pike.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't she just say a good crew? She just said to find a good crew.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She wouldn't maybe not know, necessarily.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would Pike know if there's a good crew? Let's save ten minutes on finding Pike. Would Pike know if there's a good crew?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike had one crew that she travelled with on the ocean--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're not dead, they just left her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But that crew, I will say for the sake of time, is not currently docked at Emon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She was busy doing push-ups on that cruise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go to the docks, you guys. Today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find yourself at the western docks of Emon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear the familiar sound of seagulls and other water-based fowl, mixed with the creaking of wood from large ships that are all making their way in and out of this rather large port here on the side of the Ozmit Sea. You can see there's a lot of goods coming into the city now, as a lot of heavy orders have come from nearby villages to transport goods as part of the recovery, both from the south from the Mornset as well as things that were too large to carry by cart from Syngorn, and have been coming up along the coast, avoiding Dagger Bay, and making their way up to Emon. There are a number of individuals around, and who would want to spearhead the investigation--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not good at investigating. Who's good at investigating?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll back you up. Me too, me too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 18. Oh, you've done me in by one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Asking about for a while, you eventually-- people point you in the direction of what appears to be an individual named Dockmaster Abban.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as you begin to approach, he's finishing a conversation with someone and turns to you and flashes the brightest of white smiles and goes, "Hello! Ah, you look like you are looking for some help, or in aid of something, yes? No?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're staring at me. What do you want?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We are-- I don't know if you've noticed, but the city has just been saved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've watched it be saved, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, then you maybe saw us in the fray, and now, after saving this beautiful city, we are on our way to the middle of the fucking sea. Would somebody be able to take us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, are you looking for a-- to purchase a vessel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. To rent a crew of well-seasoned sailors who know their way around the ocean.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I guess it really depends on the size of the vessel you're taking-- what ship do you have?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're looking to-- I'm cutting in for a second--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- charter, dear, charter. You're looking to charter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're looking to charter a ship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just learn so much from you, you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, just very close to Hespit, actually, not far so-- very far southwest--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're hoping for a bit of a discount for the group that is responsible for this city still existing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's much better at this than you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I have-- I apologise, I do not follow this train of thought. Discount?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't roll any kind of a check, I just got shat upon, but whatever, do your thing. And I walk off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just-- I don't feel the dice were necessary at that point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All the time! Except when it comes--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: --to me. Go, go, do your thing. Do your thing. I'm gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you-- Okay. Vax walks away before he finishes his point, and doesn't get to make his roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Forgive my brother, he gets very embarrassed when he talks about how much we've saved. Humble creature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm still very confused here. You're asking for a discount, why? Because the city was saved?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well I wasn't, of course not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look, I don't know who you are, I don't know what you're trying to do here--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now, we cannot offer discounts to anybody because right now, we're all in financial dire straits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, if you're going to ship, if you're going to move, if you're going to charter, if you're going to purchase, it's going to have to be the ask--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're looking to charter a ship, full of sailors, who can get us to a circular reef to the southwest, near the Hespit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Captain Adella. That would be your best bet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is Captain Adella. She will be able to help you."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of course. Now, if you wish to charter, speak with her. Let her know that the Dockmaster is the one that brought you that point, and all shall be well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Good luck, travel safe." And he turns around and walks aw--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy, do we tip him? I don't know how this works.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we do not tip him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I just ask before we leave, how much are the ships that are for sale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! Well, it depends on the ship that you are looking for. For a long-ship, no crew of course, which is a fairly decent speed, requires maybe 30 to 40 rowers, and a handful of deck hands, that would run you about 10,000 gold pieces?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just let me ask the important questions, you all retire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need a big-- we need a bigger ship.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I wanted a ship that had, let's say, this many sails, and came with a crew, how much would that be, about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you talking about a fully outfitted galleon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: well, I mean the crew you'd have to pay whatever they're asking, but for the actual ship, the general asking price can range somewhere in around 30,000 to 40,000 gold pieces.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 30,000 to 40,000 pieces, that's what I thought. Yep. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Obviously a man of the world.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you want a galleon, Grog?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is this thing for seasickness, with seaweed--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog, that's-- that's not like free peanuts at the tavern.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, let's go get a ship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god. Wow. We could seriously buy a ship.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could, or we could just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean we have no need for a ship.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are we going to do when we're done with it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've gotta be frugal, even though we don't have to be, we should be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not even frugal, this is just what you do once you have money--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's very, very common. It's all good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. As you guys walk to the edge of the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is crazed in appearance immediately as she arrives. She looks spry and somewhat young, maybe late 20s early 30s, but her skin has been very heavily weathered from all these days at sea, and you can see already she's getting these crows nests at the corners of her face, but has a very bright smile, and her light brown coat hangs just past her calf-high boots. She looks like the kind of woman who captains a ship. As she glances over, "Hi. You looking for a crew?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do not look like a pirate. Why would you say that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She meant it as a compliment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where do you buy your clothes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you looking for a crew or not?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why, yes we are! I assume you're Captain Adella.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. (laughs) I see my reputation precedes me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know your way around the Ozmit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Quite a bit actually, I do. Where you looking to go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Near the Hespit Sea? Near the Hespit? I don't know what the fuck I'm talking about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. We don't travel to the Hespit. That's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's near the Hespit, not quite--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We would be excited to make it worth your while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How worth our while are you thinking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is your while worth, I imagine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: that would run you-- let's put it at 150 gold per day for chartering the ship.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's six of us and a bear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, and a robot. An automaton. Can I say automaton?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He doesn't eat, it'll be fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well this has certainly got real interesting, didn't it? All right! So, have we a deal?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I think that's a fair price.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- inner working dynamics in this group that you don't know anything about--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you'd just wait a bit, all right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're right, I will be quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fine. You've found yourself a leader, a captain, and a partner." Shakes your hand. "So."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vesrah, you say? Crazy water folk. Who am I to judge? But yes, six to seven days travel at sea, depending on the weather, of course. Storms are common this time of year, do keep in mind we will be passing north of the Hespit, so be wary of any wandering bandit ships.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or pirates, you can call them pirates as well, but we already had that conversation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nope. You just look really cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What kinda weapons you got on this ship?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're the most deadly thing in this land.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How often do sea monsters sprout up on you? Ever? I've never been on the sea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have, we were just way high above it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well yeah, not like in it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh that's true, we have never been in a boat, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How many of us have actually been on a ship before?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm afraid of getting nauseous, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I had a boat in one of my larger baths that I would take at night, and it would go on epic adventures through the bubbles! But never quite at sea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Even better than I could have possibly imagined.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She is called the Drensala Vis--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is Marquesian for Luck of the Mother.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome on board the Drensala Vis.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we need anything? Do we need anything before we do--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did she just say crazy water people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think as long as the ship is prepared and has--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything you can buy on dry land?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: --everything stocked, everything it needs, I think we're just reasonable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got a couple canisters of underwater breathing that nobody else has.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I have the remnants of several bottles of liquor. I'm quite pleased.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we can do it to eight people for like an hour or something like that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That'll help in the middle of the ocean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think that Raven's Slumber is waterproof?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You imagine the enchantment probably is waterproof.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. I would hate to-- little baby, mini Trinket in there gets like drowned or something if I'm underwater.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. You don't wanna drop the iPhone in the toilet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: About what time of day is it right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, it's a little bit past three o'clock in the afternoon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shouldn't we go out early in the morning?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Isn't that what you do? You, like, set sail--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can sail all night while we sleep on the ship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wanna sleep on the ship!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's gonna be like a seven-hour trip-- or a seven-day trip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're gonna get to sleep on a hammock, Grog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can spend days on a ship.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if it's only a three-hour tour?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tary, there wo-- what is that in reference to?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. I'm not even dignifying that with a groan--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Tal, you're with me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would not even-- I expect better of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It would make for a good beginning of a chapter to set out at dawn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is true. Poetically it would be nice, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He could just write that we set out at dawn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am eager to get my adventuring on, L.E.B., so I am eager to go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Little elf girl. L.E.B. Little elf boy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, been on the sea a little long. Is your crew ready to go? Or would it be better to set sail in the morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well. We leave at your leisure, but we're not against the idea of a raucous final evening at the local tavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many beds do you have on that ship?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're asking us to get her drunk?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've really been through the shit, so I'm not opposed. Just saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not including for my crew? we have bunks for at least 15 other passengers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bunks? Or rooms? I mean, obviously you don't have rooms for--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You already can feel the spray of the water as the tide's coming in now, the water's starting to get a little choppier as it's hitting up against the side of the docks and the shore end.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A sea voyage. This is unprecedented.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is amazing. I'm so excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doty stops for a second, leans back, and then starts scribbling furiously at anything that he can pick up within earshot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tary, staring off into the distance, shat his pants. Crying, into his poo--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, okay, all right, so zing, you got me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: -- and notices the tiny member between his legs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're smarter than I thought, you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I'm as smart as you thought I was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we'll pick up next session!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As our ship sinks slowly in the west, we bid farewell!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Had that on my playlist for a long-ass time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're going on a cruise, you guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That took some interesting turns tonight!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now we learn how shitty cruises are.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I love ships. Ships are great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I'm the only character who's spent some time on a boat, at this point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who's been on a ship. And Pike--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Blindspot, stop filming! You finished your season, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get her back. Guys, thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you again Loot Crate for being our awesome sponsors this evening--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- you've been fantastic. The rest of you guys, rest well, sleep well, and is it Thursday yet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll most likely kill you in the morning.
